III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is being "touched" by another every time youth leaves the
room. The last time it happened was Tuesday. Staff members at
the facility are aware but due to staff shortages the youths are not
always supervised which is resulting in youth being touched.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted on March 5, 2024, and reported
they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 22, 2024. Youth A said Youth B makes her feel
uncomfortable and will attempt to touch her feet, breathe on her
when walking by her, and get “very close” to her. Youth A denied
Youth B ever successfully touching her, noting all incidents have
been attempts. Youth A said she is unsure if staff see these issues
or know about the way Youth B makes her feel. Youth A said Youth
B has made sexual comments to her on occasion and Staff 3 has
been present and redirected Youth B.
Youth B refused to be interviewed on February 22, 2024.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 22, 2024. Youth C said she is not aware of any
inappropriate touching between youth. Youth C said Youth A is on
a safety plan and staff are constantly checking on her and then
writing it down.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 1 said he has heard Youth B call Youth A “flat
chested” and redirected her immediately however has never heard
her made any other sexual comments to Youth A. Staff 1 said
Youth B has poor boundaries and will get close to most youth and
staff, but he has never seen her touch Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth
2

B has been working on her social skills and boundaries and has
been making progress.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 2 said Youth A told her that Youth B makes her feel
uncomfortable, tries to get close to her, and has made comments
about Youth A’s body. Staff 2 said she never saw any of these
issues during her shift, noting Youth A is on a safety plan where
staff are watching her constantly when she is in the milieu and
doing frequent checks on her when she is spending time in her
room alone.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 3 said he primarily works on the detention unit
however has spent some time with the shelter youth. Staff 3 said
he was working on February 20, 2024, and never saw any
inappropriate touching between Youth B and Youth A. Staff 3 said
there have been previous situations when Youth B will sit very
close to Youth A and he has to redirect Youth B to move or give
space between her and Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth B has poor
boundaries and will do this with most youth and it does not seem
to be specific to Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A has never disclosed
any youth touching her inappropriately to him.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 4 said Youth A and Youth B have a relationship that
is on and off, one day they are friendly and the next they are
saying mean things to one another. Staff 4 said she has never
seen or heard of Youth B touching Youth A inappropriately. Staff 4
said Youth B has been known to “body shame” other youth
however has worked on that and is doing better recently. Staff 4
said Youth A has never told her that Youth B makes her feel
uncomfortable.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 5 said she has no knowledge of Youth B touching
Youth A inappropriately. Staff 5 said Youth A is on a safety plan
and staff monitor her closely due to her self-harm behaviors.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 6 said she has no knowledge of Youth B touching
Youth A inappropriately. Staff 6 said she does not have any
concerns about the relationship between Youth A and Youth B
stating they are “typical teen girls”.
3

Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on March 21, 2024. Staff
7 said she has never seen or heard of Youth B touching Youth A
inappropriately.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’ Suicide Information Sheet dated February 1, 2024,
which places Youth A on “close observation”.
• Youth A’s Observation Logs for close observation.
Observation Logs for February 13, 2024, February 19,
2024, and February 21, 2024, were reviewed. Additional
observation logs were reviewed however not dated or
signed therefore unable to determine which day they were
completed for.
• Youth Opportunity Youth Supervision, Movement, and
Checks policy was reviewed. The staff have the expectation
to provide line of sight supervision of youth and ensure they
are aware of any changes in youth behaviors and ensuring
the youth whereabouts at all times.
Video Review:
Video footage of February 20, 2024, shelter unit was reviewed
on March 7, 2024. There is no evidence of Youth B touching
Youth A throughout the video footage reviewed.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Staff Sufficiency as there is
no evidence that Youth A was inappropriately touched by Youth B
while staff were not supervising.
Technical Assistance:
It is recommended the facility provide refresher training to all staff
on dating and signing documents. In addition, it is recommended
that the Therapist follow up with staff if dates or signatures are
missing when she receives documentation for review.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4148 Personal hygiene
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4148 Personal hygiene
Section (1) An institution shall assure that each resident maintains or
Description receives personal care, hygiene, and grooming appropriate to the
resident’s age, sex, race, cultural background, and health needs.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff are not providing personal hygiene products to youth.
4

Investigation Interviews:
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 22, 2024. Youth C said she has no shampoo,
conditioner, or toothpaste and that the facility does not have toilet
paper. Youth C said she has requested these personal hygiene
products during town meetings each week as well as daily to each
staff working. Youth C said a Staff 7 ended up buying her supplies
out of her own money.
Youth B refused to be interviewed on February 22, 2024.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 1 said hygiene products are stored in the laundry
room and supply closet. Staff 1 said all staff have access to get
these items and youth just let staff know when they run out and
they get them more. Staff 1 said just a few days ago Youth C told
him she was out of toothpaste, and he got her a new tube the
same day. Staff 1 said if youth want a special product or brand,
they can request it during town meeting and administration buys it
the next time they go to the store. Staff 1 said he has no
knowledge of youth running out and not being given more
products.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 2 said the youth always have the hygiene supplies
that they need to care for themselves. Staff 2 said if the youth run
out of something there is a supply closet, or a staff member will
run to the store and get them what they need the same day. Staff
2 said she is unaware of any youth going without.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 3 said he has no knowledge of any youth going
without personal hygiene products. Staff 3 said each youth has
their own and there is a supply closet with all the extra products
should a youth run out. Staff 3 said he know that some youths
have had special supplies purchased for them as well.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 4 said all of the youth are provided with personal
hygiene products whenever they need them. Staff 4 said there is a
lot of extra products stored in the laundry room and supply closet
which staff are able to access. Staff 4 said she has not been made
aware of any youth not having personal hygiene products however
she is aware of some of the youth refusing to use the products
given to them and want other brands. Staff 4 said many times the
youth are allowed to request the brands that they prefer during the
5

weekly town meeting, and it will be provided to them, however
they always have products available to them at the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 5 said all the youth have personal hygiene
products. Staff 5 said there are additional supplies in the laundry
room and supply closet that staff can access when a youth runs
out of something.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 6 said all of the youth have personal hygiene
products on the unit and the extra products are in the laundry
room and supply closet when the youth run out of something.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on March 21, 2024. Staff
7 said there is always a supply of personal hygiene products
available for the youth at the facility. Staff 7 said she did buy
Youth C some additional products for her birthday.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on February 22, 2024. The laundry
room and supply room were viewed and had a full supply of
shampoo, conditioner, soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, and
additional hair products. The shelter unit was viewed along with
the shower products for each youth.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Personal Hygiene as the
youth each have their own Personal Hygiene products on the unit
and the facility has additional supplies in the laundry room and
supply room.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff are vaping around the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant/Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on February 22, 2024. Youth A reported that Staff 6 will
6

“vape” in front of the youth and in the van on outings. Youth A said
Staff 6 has a “Pink and Blue Breeze” that she uses. Youth A said
Staff 6 will do this when no other staff are around. Youth A said
she has never told any staff about Staff 6 vaping.
Youth B refused to be interviewed on February 22, 2024.
Complainant/Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on February 22, 2024. Youth C said she has never seen
a staff member vape in front of her or in the van.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 1 said he has never seen or heard of staff vaping
around the youth. Staff 1 said there is a designated smoking area
off grounds for the staff if they smoke or vape.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 2 said she has no knowledge of staff vaping with
the youth, in front of the youth, or in a facility vehicle.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 3 said he has no knowledge of a staff vaping in the
facility vehicle or in front of the youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 4 said she has never seen or heard of any staff
vaping in front of the youth or in the facility vehicles.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 5 said she has not seen or been told of staff vaping
in front of the youth or in the facility vehicles.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 6 said she has never vaped in front of the youth or
in a facility vehicle. Staff 6 said she has never seen any other staff
vaping in front of youth or in the facility vehicle.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on March 21, 2024. Staff
7 said she has never seen or heard of staff vaping in the facility
vehicle or in front of the youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 6’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary actions in
her file.
7

• Youth Opportunity Standard of Conduct policy was
reviewed. The policy prohibits staff from smoking in the
workplace.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Program Statement. There
is no evidence that Staff 6 or any other staff were vaping in front of
the youth at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care worker.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff are not following the ratio the facility requires per their policy.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth B refused to be interviewed on February 22, 2024.
Complainant/Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on February 22, 2024. Youth C reported that the facility
frequently operates out of ratio and will only have one staff
working with all the shelter youth. Youth C said it has always
happened on the weekends and will usually be Staff 2 working
alone.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 1 said he does not normally work weekends but
has no knowledge of staff being out of ratio.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 2 said there have been times during her
employment where she is the only staff working the shelter unit on
the weekends. Staff 2 said she has worked with more than two
youth. Staff 2 was unable to recall dates this occurred other than it
being on a weekend.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 3 said the shelter unit has to be one staff with
every two youth and he is not aware of any times when they have
operated out of ratio.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 4 said she works weekends and has never been
8

out of ratio. Staff 4 says there have been times staff have called in
for their shifts so they hold over the third shift staff until someone
can be called in or they will have the nurse work the unit with the
staff.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 5 said the shelter unit never operates out of ratio,
staff will be held over from third shift if needed or someone will be
called into work. Staff 5 said she is the one notified if a staff calls
in or does not come to work and will come into work herself or call
another staff member to come into work.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 6 said she never works on the weekends so she
does not know if they are in ratio or not, however all shifts she
works during the week they are in ratio of one staff to two youth on
the shelter unit.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on March 21, 2024. Staff
7 said she works third shift and has never been out of ratio. Staff 7
said at times she is mandated to stay over so that the facility is not
out of ratio until staff come in for the next shift.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity Youth Supervision, Movement, and
Checks policy was reviewed. The staff are expected to
work 1 staff for every 2 youth in the shelter program during
“awake hours”.
• A review of the Osceola Youth Center schedule was
completed for February 2024. There were always at least
two staff scheduled for the shelter unit for all first and
second shifts.
Video Review:
Video footage of several random dates in February 2024,
shelter unit was reviewed on March 7, 2024. Throughout each
video clip there is at least two staff working the shelter units.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Staff to resident ratio. After
interviews with staff, review of staff schedule, and video review the
facility is found in compliance with staff ratio as there was no
evidence that the facility is operating outside of the required ratio.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
9

Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(v) Peer-on-peer discipline.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff allow youth to verbally discipline another youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 22, 2024. Youth A said Staff 6 allows Youth C to go to
her room and yell at her to get up, do her chores, or tell her what
she has done incorrectly. Youth A said Staff 6 will watch or
encourage Youth C to be “the staff”, reporting it happens daily.
Youth A said other staff have seen this happen and do not stop it,
however she was unable to remember which staff.
Youth B refused to be interviewed on February 22, 2024.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 22, 2024. Youth C said staff do not allow the youth to
discipline each other. Youth C said she does tell the other youth to
follow the rules or pick up after themselves because she wants to
live in a clean place and be able to go on outings off campus and
needs the other youth to follow rules and do chores so they can
go on these activities. Youth C denied going into any other youth’s
room. Youth C denied ever being allowed or encouraged to “staff”
the other youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 1 said Youth C is very “bossy” towards the other
youth and tries to be “junior staff” but is always redirected for her
behaviors, and he has never heard of Staff 6 allowing Youth C to
discipline Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 2 said Youth C is very “bossy” and tries to act like
a staff on the unit. Staff 2 said Youth C tried to redirect the other
youth and tell them what to do and staff are constantly redirecting
Youth C for these behaviors and reminding her she is not a staff
member.
10

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 3 said Youth C attempts to tell the other youth
what to do however staff redirect this behavior whenever they see
it. Staff 3 said he has no knowledge of staff allowing Youth C to
provide any discipline to youth on the unit.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
22, 2024. Staff 4 said Youth C is always “acting very bossy
towards the other girls” and will yell at them or tell them what to do
however staff always intervene and redirect Youth C’s behaviors.
Staff 4 denied ever seeing or hearing Youth C being allowed to
discipline or redirect any of the youth.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 5 said she is not aware of Youth C, or any other
youth being allowed to discipline the other youth.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
27, 2024. Staff 6 said Youth C always wants things her way and
will yell in the milieu and try to tell the other youth what to do. Staff
6 said staff redirect these behaviors and never encourage or allow
her to yell at other youth.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on March 21, 2024. Staff
7 said Youth C has never been allowed to discipline the other
youth on any of her shifts. Staff 7 said Youth C is very verbal
about what she wants and will yell at the other youth however staff
redirect and are not allowing her to redirect the other youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity Behavior Motivation System Policy was
reviewed. The policy prohibits youth from disciplining other
youth.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Intervention standards and
prohibitions as all staff report Youth C being redirected for
attempting to tell other youth what to do. Youth A did not disclose
being given consequences by Youth C.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
